description.h2: An XBRL document must not contain HTML character name references.
description.p: Section 5.2.2.6 defines extended ASCII characters and how they may be referenced in HTML, but XBRL documents are not HTML documents, and recognize only XML predefined entities (" & ' < and >). To include characters greater than 127, use XML numeric character references. For example, ® and ® are ASCII sequences producing the ® symbol.
REMARK: This test suite does NOT test to see that only the subset of ASCII allowed by 5.2.1.1 are used.

variation.name: Instance has HTML characters in footnote
variation.description: Tests that incorrect characters are caught

variation.name: Label linkbase has HTML characters
variation.description: Tests that incorrect characters are caught
